title: A, B and C can do a piece of work in 6, 12 and 8 days respectively. They undertook to finish the work together for Rs. 53650. What is the difference (in Rs.) between the share of A and that of C? - Quora

response.answer_text: Their (A,B & C) per day efficiency is in ratio ={(1/6):(1/12):(1/8)=4:2:3. So their total payment would be distributed in the ratio 4:2;3 => (constant of proportionality being x) => their individual shares are 4x,2x & 3x respectively. => their sum (4x+2x+3x=9x)=Rs53650 =x=Rs 5961.10. So differnce between A & C =(4x-3x)=x So it is Rs5961.10. Ans..

LCM of 6,12 and 8=24 Efficiency of A=24/6=4 Efficiency of B=24/12=2 Efficiency of C=24/8=3 Therefore A, B and C share the amount of Rs 53650 in the ratio of 4:2:3 respectively. Share of A=53650/9*4=Rs 23844.44 and share of C=53650/9*3=Rs 17883.33 Tthe difference (in Rs.) between the share of A and that of C=Rs 5761.11
